falsificationAttempts.description: Reviewed the spec-signature builder and UI forms to see whether they tolerate removing counts from experiment config.
falsificationAttempts.result: `buildExperimentSpecSignature` normalizes and serializes `sample_count` and `evidence_cap`, and the lab editor/experiment detail pages expect those fields on `config.scoring_stage`, so dropping them would change template dedup logic and break the public form contract.

counterEvidence.description: Spec signatures currently include counts, so removing them alters the deduplication/checksum that governs template reuse.
Lab editor and experiment page both treat `sample_count`/`evidence_cap` as experiment-config fields (validation, display, and exposed inputs).

notes: The hidden dependencies on experiment-scoped counts mean the migration path assumes capabilities that the current system explicitly violates, so the hypothesis cannot be accepted without additional refactors.
